speaker: FLAVIUS
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: FLAVIUS
text_entry: SCENE I. A room in Lucullus' house.

speaker: FLAVIUS
text_entry: FLAMINIUS waiting. Enter a Servant to him

speaker: Servant
text_entry: I have told my lord of you; he is coming down to you.

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: I thank you, sir.

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: Enter LUCULLUS

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Here's my lord.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: [Aside]  One of Lord Timon's men? a gift, I

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: warrant. Why, this hits right; I dreamt of a silver

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: basin and ewer to-night. Flaminius, honest

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: Flaminius; you are very respectively welcome, sir.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: Fill me some wine.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: Exit Servants

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: And how does that honourable, complete, free-hearted

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: gentleman of Athens, thy very bountiful good lord

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: and master?

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: His health is well sir.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: I am right glad that his health is well, sir: and

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: what hast thou there under thy cloak, pretty Flaminius?

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: 'Faith, nothing but an empty box, sir; which, in my

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: lord's behalf, I come to entreat your honour to

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: supply; who, having great and instant occasion to

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: use fifty talents, hath sent to your lordship to

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: furnish him, nothing doubting your present

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: assistance therein.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: La, la, la, la! 'nothing doubting,' says he? Alas,

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: good lord! a noble gentleman 'tis, if he would not

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: keep so good a house. Many a time and often I ha'

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: dined with him, and told him on't, and come again to

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: supper to him, of purpose to have him spend less,

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: and yet he would embrace no counsel, take no warning

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: by my coming. Every man has his fault, and honesty

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: is his: I ha' told him on't, but I could ne'er get

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: him from't.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: Re-enter Servant, with wine

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Please your lordship, here is the wine.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: Flaminius, I have noted thee always wise. Here's to thee.

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: Your lordship speaks your pleasure.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: I have observed thee always for a towardly prompt

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: spirit--give thee thy due--and one that knows what

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: belongs to reason; and canst use the time well, if

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: the time use thee well: good parts in thee.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: To Servant

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: Get you gone, sirrah.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: Draw nearer, honest Flaminius. Thy lord's a

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: bountiful gentleman: but thou art wise; and thou

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: knowest well enough, although thou comest to me,

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: that this is no time to lend money, especially upon

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: bare friendship, without security. Here's three

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: solidares for thee: good boy, wink at me, and say

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: thou sawest me not. Fare thee well.

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: Is't possible the world should so much differ,

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: And we alive that lived? Fly, damned baseness,

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: To him that worships thee!

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: Throwing the money back

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: Ha! now I see thou art a fool, and fit for thy master.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: May these add to the number that may scald thee!

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: Let moulten coin be thy damnation,

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: Thou disease of a friend, and not himself!

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: Has friendship such a faint and milky heart,

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: It turns in less than two nights? O you gods,

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: I feel master's passion! this slave,

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: Unto his honour, has my lord's meat in him:

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: Why should it thrive and turn to nutriment,

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: When he is turn'd to poison?

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: O, may diseases only work upon't!

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: And, when he's sick to death, let not that part of nature

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: Which my lord paid for, be of any power

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: To expel sickness, but prolong his hour!

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text_entry: Exit
